<@U01PE2S4ZL6>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Should we reaching out to customers with double free-treats ?`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hey, we have discovered over 70 users with double free-treats in their boxes. This happened due to a backend bug, and we patched it on the frontend side already. Users in such subscriptions state, due to BE business logic, were locked out from making any meal-selection changes. So we had to "re-subscribe" them to single free-treats package. 

Some of them may notice now that they are receiving one package less - these are mostly high retention customers. Question is should CRM reach out to them, to explain the change?

Here is the list of affected customers and subscriptions, Add-on index is the single free-treat they got subscribed to: <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mm2m_LEvG1kRCBFfEaKZmdxmWue3s0MRvzAURxeB9fk/edit?gid=0#gid=0>`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question
attachments.text:
<@U01PE2S4ZL6>: Hi, I'd like to ask a question! Please check the details.
*Question title:* `Should we reaching out to customers with double free-treats ?`
*Topic:* `Other`
*Details:* `Hey, we have discovered over 70 users with double free-treats in their boxes. This happened due to a backend bug, and we patched it on the frontend side already. Users in such subscriptions state, due to BE business logic, were locked out from making any meal-selection changes. So we had to "re-subscribe" them to single free-treats package. 

Some of them may notice now that they are receiving one package less - these are mostly high retention customers. Question is should CRM reach out to them, to explain the change?

Here is the list of affected customers and subscriptions, Add-on index is the single free-treat they got subscribed to: <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mm2m_LEvG1kRCBFfEaKZmdxmWue3s0MRvzAURxeB9fk/edit?gid=0#gid=0>`

*Category:* squad-nv-pet-food
*Command:* pet-food-question

_thread_replies.text:
:sparkles: *Automatic Answer:* 
Based on the information provided, here's a suggested approach:

1. *Reach out to affected customers*: Given that these are high-retention customers who may notice the change, it's advisable to proactively communicate with them.

2. *Explain the situation*: 
   - Acknowledge the backend bug that caused double free-treats
   - Mention that it has been fixed
   - Explain that their subscription has been adjusted to the correct single free-treat package

3. *Offer compensation or goodwill gesture*: Consider offering a one-time bonus treat or discount to maintain customer satisfaction.

4. *Provide clear next steps*: Inform customers that they can now make meal-selection changes as usual.

5. *Be transparent*: Honesty about the error and its resolution can help maintain trust.

6. *Monitor feedback*: Keep track of customer responses to this communication for any necessary follow-up actions.

For more details on affected customers and subscriptions, please refer to the spreadsheet <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mm2m_LEvG1kRCBFfEaKZmdxmWue3s0MRvzAURxeB9fk/edit?gid=0#gid=0|here>.
 *Additional sources:*
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C04FVDBJZCK/p1703196983236409?thread_ts=1703196983.236409&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Please reset W52 customers to Trial>
<https://hellofresh.slack.com/archives/C055W2FSZ3N/p1716390943932689?thread_ts=1716390943.932689&utm_source=slack-commander|[Q&A] Free Shipping in Cart Summary> :warning:_This answer was generated based on the available documentation mentioned above, proceed with caution._

Does this resolve your query, <@U01PE2S4ZL6>? Unified Search :mag: button

5. *Be transparent*: Honesty about the error and its resolution can help maintain trust.

_thread_replies.text: sometimes for multiple boxes... :confused: some of them were receiving it across 3-4-5 boxes

elements.text: some of them were receiving it across 3-4-5 boxes

elements.text: here is the full list of customers

_thread_replies.text: got it. <@U05HHDYS65N> what are your thoughts on this? I think it's ok to not email them as they were just getting additional freebies, I think it would be an issue if the treat was missing but wanted to get your POV

elements.text: what are your thoughts on this? I think it's ok to not email them as they were just getting additional freebies, I think it would be an issue if the treat was missing but wanted to get your POV

_thread_replies.text: And we had to fix this, because regardless if we were suffering financially or not by sending those extra packages, this "double selection" state, was preventing affected users from making any meal change. So there was a risk they would get upset about the bug and cancel subscription, without even correlating it with receiving double free-treats

elements.text: And we had to fix this, because regardless if we were suffering financially or not by sending those extra packages, this "double selection" state, was preventing affected users from making any meal change. So there was a risk they would get upset about the bug and cancel subscription, without even correlating it with receiving double free-treats

elements.text: haha yeah thats why i was confused bc none of our other free treats are handled through tech so I was just wondering what this was referring too, but must be free for life

_thread_replies.text: sorry Lindsay I missed this - I think if they were expecting 1 treat and just got extra, and if it's just 70 customers then it's fine to not email since it's an unexpected benefit not issue
